statements.name: PROC SGSCATTER
statements.description: Identifies the data set that contains the plot variables. The statement also gives you the option to specify a description and write template code to a file.

arguments.name: BACKCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of the graph area.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS data set that contains the variables to process.

arguments.name: DATACOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the fill colors for the graphics elements, such as CLM bands and filled markers.

arguments.name: DATACONTRASTCOLORS=
arguments.description: specifies the contrast colors for the graphics elements, such as lines and markers.

arguments.name: DATALINEPATTERNS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of line patterns for the graph data lines.

arguments.name: DATASYMBOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the list of marker symbol for the graph data.

arguments.name: DATTRMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the discrete attribute map data set that you want to use with the SGSCATTER procedure.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description for the output image.

arguments.name: NOSUBPIXEL
arguments.description: specifies whether subpixel rendering should be used for rendering curved lines.

arguments.name: SUBPIXEL
arguments.description: specifies whether subpixel rendering should be used for rendering curved lines.

arguments.name: OPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: NOOPAQUE
arguments.description: specifies whether the graph background is opaque or transparent.

arguments.name: PAD=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space that is reserved inside the border of an annotated graph.

arguments.name: LEFT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the left edge.

arguments.name: RIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the right edge.

arguments.name: TOP=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the top edge.

arguments.name: BOTTOM=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of extra space to add to the bottom edge.

arguments.name: RATTRMAP=
arguments.description: specifies the range attribute map data set that you want to use with the procedure.

arguments.name: SGANNO=
arguments.description: specifies the SG annotation data set that you want to use.

arguments.name: TMPLOUT=
arguments.description: specifies a file destination for the template code that is generated by the SGSCATTER procedure.

arguments.name: WALLCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the plot wall area.

statements.name: COMPARE
statements.description: Creates a comparative panel of scatter plots with shared axes.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables for the X axis.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: specifies the one or more variables for the Y axis.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in an attribute map data set.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used with the COLORRESPONSE= option.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color legend.

arguments.name: DATALABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the data label with respect to the plot.
arguments.help: DATALABELPOS=BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP | BOTTOMLEFT | LEFT | TOPLEFT | BOTTOMRIGHT | RIGHT | TOPRIGHT

arguments.name: ELLIPSE
arguments.description: Adds a confidence or prediction ellipse to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ELLIPSE=
arguments.description: Adds a confidence or prediction ellipse to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: CLIP
arguments.description: specifies that X and Y values for the ellipse are ignored when determining the data ranges for the axes.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of ellipse.

arguments.name: FILLEDOUTLINEDMARKERS
arguments.description: specifies that markers have a fill and an outline.

arguments.name: GRADLEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of a continuous color legend when the COLORRESPONSE= option is used.

arguments.name: BORDER
arguments.description: adds a border around the legend.

arguments.name: INTEGER
arguments.description: specifies that integers are used for the gradient legend.

arguments.name: NOTITLE
arguments.description: removes the default title. The default title is the name of the response variable.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the legend within the graph.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: specifies the label for the legend.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines for each tick on both axes.

arguments.name: GRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the grid lines.

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: specifies a classification variable to divide the values into groups.

arguments.name: JITTER
arguments.description: specifies that data markers are offset when multiple observations have the same response value.

arguments.name: JOIN
arguments.description: specifies that line segments join all of the scatter points.

arguments.name: JOIN=
arguments.description: specifies that line segments join all of the scatter points.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the join lines.

arguments.name: SMOOTHCONNECT
arguments.description: specifies that a smoothed line passes through all vertices.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the legend for the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ACROSS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the legend.

arguments.name: ATTRMAP
arguments.description: specifies that the items defined in an attribute map data set are shown in the legend regardless of whether they are used in this graph.

arguments.name: AUTOITEMSIZE
arguments.description: specifies that all markers in the legend are sized in proportion to the font size used for the legend labels.

arguments.name: DOWN=
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the legend.

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: removes the border from the legend.

arguments.name: NOTITLE
arguments.description: removes the label from the legend.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the position of the legend within the graph.

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: places the legend at the bottom of the graph.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: places the legend at the left side of the graph.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: places the legend at the right side of the graph.

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: places the legend at the top of the graph.

arguments.name: SORTORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order to use for the legend entry labels.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: specifies the label for the legend.

arguments.name: LOESS
arguments.description: Adds a loess fit to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: LOESS=
arguments.description: Adds a loess fit to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for a mean predicted value for each observation.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the local polynomials to use for each local regression.
specifies a linear fit.
specifies a quadratic fit.

arguments.name: INTERPOLATION=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the interpolating polynomials that are used for blending local polynomial fits at the kd tree vertices.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the fit line.

arguments.name: NOGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the fit does not use the group variable from the scatter plot.

arguments.name: SMOOTH=
arguments.description: specifies a smoothing parameter value.

arguments.name: MARKERATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the markers in the plot.

arguments.name: MARKERFILLATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the marker fill.

arguments.name: MARKEROUTLINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the marker outlines.

arguments.name: MINORGRID
arguments.description: creates grid lines at each minor tick on both axes.

arguments.name: MINORGRIDATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the minor grid lines.

arguments.name: NOGRADLEGEND
arguments.description: turns off the display of the continuous color legend that appears when the COLORRESPONSE= option is used.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: removes the legend from the plot.

arguments.name: NOWALL
arguments.description: turns off the display of the graph wall’s fill and outline.

arguments.name: PBSPLINE
arguments.description: adds a fitted, penalized B-spline curve to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: PBSPLINE=
arguments.description: adds a fitted, penalized B-spline curve to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: CLI
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for individual predicted values for each observation.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for a mean predicted value for each observation.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the spline transformation.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the curve line.

arguments.name: NKNOTS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of evenly spaced internal knots.

arguments.name: NOGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the curve does not use the group variable from the scatter plot.

arguments.name: SMOOTH=
arguments.description: specifies a smoothing parameter value.

arguments.name: RATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in a range attribute map data set.

arguments.name: REFTICKS
arguments.description: duplicates the tick marks from the X and Y axes on the opposite sides of the graph.

arguments.name: REFTICKS=
arguments.description: duplicates the tick marks from the X and Y axes on the opposite sides of the graph.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the axis label.

arguments.name: NOTICKS
arguments.description: suppresses the tick marks.

arguments.name: VALUES
arguments.description: in addition to the tick marks, displays the values that are represented by the tick marks.

arguments.name: REG
arguments.description: adds a regression fit to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: REG=
arguments.description: adds a regression fit to the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: CLI
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for individual predicted values for each observation.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for a mean predicted value for each observation.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the polynomial fit.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the fit line.

arguments.name: NOGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the fit does not use the group variable from the scatter plot.

arguments.name: SPACING=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing (in pixels) that is placed between the cells in the graph.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between all cells.

arguments.name: ROW=
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between cell rows.

arguments.name: COLUMN=
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between cell columns.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text for data labels is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: displays data tips using the data obtained from the specified variables.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot components.

arguments.name: numeric-variable-1 numeric-variable-2 numeric-variable-n
arguments.description: specifies two or more numeric variables for the matrix.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in an attribute map data set.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used with the COLORRESPONSE= option.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color legend.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that is used to create data labels for each point in the plot.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the data label with respect to the plot.
arguments.help: DATALABELPOS=BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP | BOTTOMLEFT | LEFT | TOPLEFT | BOTTOMRIGHT | RIGHT | TOPRIGHT

arguments.name: DIAGONAL=
arguments.description: adds graphs to the diagonal cells of the plot matrix.

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: specifies a histogram.

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: specifies a kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: specifies a normal density curve.

arguments.name: ELLIPSE
arguments.description: Adds a confidence or prediction ellipse to each cell that contains a scatter plot.

arguments.name: ELLIPSE=

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: specifies whether the diagonal starts in the top left corner or the bottom left corner.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: displays data tips using the data obtained from the specified variables.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot components.

statements.name: PLOT
statements.description: Creates a paneled graph that contains multiple independent scatter plots.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the left vertical axis.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variable plotted on the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: y-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the left vertical axes.

arguments.name: x-variable
arguments.description: variables plotted on the horizontal axes.

arguments.name: ASPECT=
arguments.description: specifies the aspect ratio of the plot’s wall area.

arguments.name: ATTRID=
arguments.description: specifies the value of the ID variable in an attribute map data set.

arguments.name: AXISEXTENT=
arguments.description: specifies the extent of the axis line for the axes.

arguments.name: FULL
arguments.description: the axis lines extend along the entire length of the axis.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: the axis lines extend through the data range from the minimum data point to the maximum data point.

arguments.name: COLORMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a color ramp that is to be used with the COLORRESPONSE= option.

arguments.name: style-element
arguments.description: specifies the name of a style element.

arguments.name: (color-list)
arguments.description: specifies a space-separated list of colors to use in the color ramp.

arguments.name: COLORRESPONSE=
arguments.description: specifies the numeric column that is used to map colors to a continuous color legend.

arguments.name: COLUMNS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns in the graph.

arguments.name: DATALABEL
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABEL=
arguments.description: displays a label for each data point.

arguments.name: DATALABELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies the location of the data label with respect to the plot.
arguments.help: DATALABELPOS=BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP | BOTTOMLEFT | LEFT | TOPLEFT | BOTTOMRIGHT | RIGHT | TOPRIGHT

arguments.name: MEAN

arguments.description: adds a regression fit to the scatter plot.

arguments.description: specifies the confidence level for the confidence limits.

arguments.name: CLI
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for individual predicted values for each observation.

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: creates confidence limits for a mean predicted value for each observation.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of the polynomial fit.

arguments.name: LINEATTRS=
arguments.description: specifies the appearance of the fit line.

arguments.name: NOGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the fit does not use the group variable from the scatter plot.

arguments.name: ROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of rows in the graph.

arguments.name: SPACING=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing (in pixels) that is placed between the cells in the graph, if the PLOT statement creates multiple cells.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between all cells.

arguments.name: ROW=
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between cell rows.

arguments.name: COLUMN=
arguments.description: specifies the spacing in pixels between cell columns.

arguments.name: SPLITCHAR=
arguments.description: specifies one or more characters on which the text for data labels is always split.

arguments.name: SPLITCHARNODROP
arguments.description: specifies that the split characters are included in the displayed value.

arguments.name: SPLITJUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the horizontal alignment of the value text that is being split.

arguments.name: TIP=
arguments.description: displays data tips using the data obtained from the specified variables.

arguments.name: TIPFORMAT=
arguments.description: applies formats to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TIPLABEL=
arguments.description: applies labels to the list of data tip variables that you specify in the TIP= option.

arguments.name: TRANSPARENCY=
arguments.description: specifies the degree of transparency for the plot components.

arguments.name: UNISCALE=
arguments.description: specifies that the X axis, Y axis, or both axes are scaled uniformly for all of the cells in the graph.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
